column4: if i compile a 2.6.19 kernel and patch it with 2.6.20-rc4 would it be able to run kvm??
you might ruin the kernel if you do that
don't apply patches to applications they arent meant for .. in your case dont patch 2.6.19 with 2.6.20-rc4
i thought thats how u patch judging from the guide im reading
here it says u shud not patch kernel say 2.6.19.1 with 2.6.20-rc4
errrm, thats what i said too, no?
errm, well, it might work but might not work either .. you  can try it out by all means but "you have been warned"
might as well hey. thx for the warning
it might fix some of the acpi issues i been having

well, the way i see it .. the changes of code are most radical within kernel development .. major changes happen even in the smallest revisions .. and given that patches change code at specific locations within the source, you might be breaking stuff
in this instance it is almost like applying a patch written for application A  on application B
well its dled so i tell u how it goes
sry to touble u again but is there someway where i can find details on the setting with make menuconfig?
